title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he wasn't rooting for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, citing no personal investment.
Brady later expressed support for Patriots owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, encouraging the team to win a seventh Super Bowl.
Brady faced criticism from former teammates Vince Wilfork and Robert Spillane for not publicly backing the Patriots earlier.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Jeff Saturday and Mina Kimes argue for Drake Maye as NFL MVP over winner Matthew Stafford.
Maye completed the 2025 regular season with 4,394 passing yards and 35 total touchdowns.
Stafford won the NFL MVP after leading the league with 4,707 passing yards and 46 touchdowns.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots will focus on pressuring Seahawks QB Sam Darnold, who struggled under pressure in the regular season.
Seahawks' defense ranks top in several categories but is vulnerable to QB scrambles, a potential advantage for Drake Maye.
Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane's ankle injury may affect their run defense against Seattle's strong rushing attack.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' quarterback Drake Maye has no injury designation and is expected to play in the Super Bowl.
Linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are listed as questionable for Sunday's game against the Seahawks.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is also questionable due to a hamstring injury, despite full practice participation.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' is a contemporary Western film available on Netflix, featuring Chris Pine and Ben Foster.
'Splitsville,' a 2025 romantic comedy, is streaming on Hulu, starring Michael Angelo Covino and Dakota Johnson.
The 2026 Winter Olympics are streaming on Peacock, featuring a Gold Zone with continuous live event coverage.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs's phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' has inspired New England Patriots players and fans.
The Patriots, spurred by Diggs's leadership, staged a dramatic turnaround, winning 15 of their last 16 games.
Diggs faces legal issues with assault charges but continues to lead the Patriots into Super Bowl LX.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris from North Attleboro is running her first marathon, the 2026 Boston Marathon, for Mass. General Hospital.
Demeris is raising funds for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund supporting emergency response, cancer care, and veterans' programs.
Her personal connections include a friend in MGH's emergency department and her mother, a two-time breast cancer survivor.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets' South End location to close in June after 28 years, citing high costs and necessary updates.
Neighborhood opposed proposed Croft School takeover, leading to school withdrawing plans to occupy the space.
A Change.org petition against losing retail space has over 1,500 signatures; Foodie's focuses on South Boston location.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The @DrakeMayeLover Instagram account has nearly 400,000 followers, celebrating Patriots quarterback Drake Maye since May 2024.
The meme account, posting over 1,000 times, shares devout support and sells merchandise dedicated to Drake Maye.
The anonymous account owner may reveal their identity after meeting Maye and taking a photo together.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady's neutral stance on Patriots vs. Seahawks at Super Bowl LX disappoints many New England fans.
Nearly 700 Boston.com readers express mixed reactions to Brady's comments, feeling disconnected from the Patriots.
Some fans defend Brady, citing his contributions and career change, while others feel his neutrality undermines loyalty.
